full_name: Anti-Money Laundering and Know Your Customer Global Standards
description: International standards for Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Customer (KYC) based on FATF recommendations, implemented globally through national legislation.

key_requirements.title: Customer Due Diligence (CDD)
key_requirements.description: Financial institutions must identify and verify customer identity before establishing business relationships
requirements: Verify customer identity using reliable, independent source documents
Identify beneficial owners and control structure for legal entities
Understand the purpose and nature of the business relationship
Conduct ongoing due diligence and transaction monitoring
Apply enhanced due diligence for high-risk customers

key_requirements.title: Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD)
key_requirements.description: Apply additional scrutiny for high-risk customers, PEPs, and cross-border transactions
requirements: Identify Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) and obtain senior management approval
Determine source of wealth and source of funds for high-risk customers
Conduct enhanced monitoring of business relationship and transactions
Apply additional verification measures for non-face-to-face customers
Review relationships with customers from high-risk jurisdictions

key_requirements.title: Transaction Monitoring
key_requirements.description: Monitor transactions to detect suspicious activity and patterns indicative of money laundering
requirements: Implement automated transaction monitoring systems
Define and regularly update suspicious activity scenarios
Monitor for unusual transaction patterns, volumes, or velocities
Screen transactions against sanctions lists (OFAC, UN, EU)
Generate alerts for manual review by compliance team

key_requirements.title: Suspicious Activity Reporting (SAR)
key_requirements.description: Report suspicious transactions to Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU)
requirements: File Suspicious Activity Reports when money laundering is suspected
Submit reports to appropriate FIU within regulatory timeframes
Include all relevant transaction details and suspicion basis
Maintain confidentiality and prohibit tipping off customers
Keep records of all SARs filed for regulatory retention period

key_requirements.title: Record Keeping
key_requirements.description: Maintain comprehensive records of customer identification, transactions, and compliance activities
requirements: Retain customer identification records for minimum 5 years after relationship ends
Keep transaction records for minimum 5 years after completion
Document risk assessments and due diligence decisions
Maintain audit trail of all compliance activities
Ensure records are available for regulatory inspections

key_requirements.title: Risk-Based Approach
key_requirements.description: Implement risk-based AML/CFT framework tailored to business risk profile
requirements: Conduct enterprise-wide AML/CFT risk assessment
Assess customer risk based on product, geography, and profile
Implement controls proportionate to identified risks
Document risk assessment methodology and findings
Review and update risk assessments periodically

key_requirements.title: AML Compliance Program
key_requirements.description: Establish comprehensive AML compliance program with policies, procedures, and training
requirements: Appoint AML Compliance Officer with adequate authority
Develop written AML policies and procedures
Conduct regular AML training for all relevant employees
Perform independent audit of AML program annually
Implement internal controls and sanctions screening

key_requirements.title: Sanctions Screening
key_requirements.description: Screen customers and transactions against international sanctions lists
requirements: Screen against OFAC SDN, UN, EU, and other relevant sanctions lists
Perform screening at onboarding and ongoing basis
Implement real-time transaction screening
Document screening results and match resolution
Update sanctions lists daily or as required

compliance_checklist: Customer identification and verification procedures implemented
Beneficial ownership identification for legal entities
Enhanced Due Diligence for high-risk customers and PEPs
Customer and transaction records retention for minimum 5 years
AML Compliance Officer appointed with adequate authority
AML policies and procedures documented and communicated
Annual AML training program for employees
Independent audit of AML program completed annually
Source of wealth and funds verification for high-risk customers

penalties.description: Penalties for AML non-compliance vary by jurisdiction but typically include:
examples: Civil monetary penalties ranging from millions to billions USD
Criminal prosecution of individuals and institutions
Revocation or suspension of banking/financial services license
Reputational damage and loss of correspondent banking relationships

high_risk_indicators: Unusual transaction patterns inconsistent with customer profile
Structuring transactions to avoid reporting thresholds
Rapid movement of funds through accounts
Transactions involving shell companies or complex ownership structures
Customer reluctance to provide information or documentation
Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) without clear source of wealth
